page.title: 14Mannington-Farmlands
page.content: { Mannington Farm is typical of the network of small farms which cover the area of S.Heathland which once covered most of SE Dorset stretching from Wimborne in the the West to the banks of the Solent in the East.This area of heathland was largely man created,much of it was also forested the biggest streches of Forest lying in the area of the present New Forest borders. Since the turn of the century more and more of this heathland formely only had two uses timber and grazing has been converted to permanent pasture for dairy farming or to fields for arable crops.This trend has continued up to the present date making the pockets of heathland smaller and smaller to the extent that some now need to be protected as reserves or sights of special scientific interest.(See Holt Heath)
